greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of the product of n and the n-th alternating harmonic number, Sum_{k=1..n} (-1)^(k+1)/k.
comment: a(n) almost always equals A058313(n), which is the numerator of the n-th alternating harmonic number, Sum ((-1)^(k+1)/k, k=1..n), except for n = 15, 28, 75, 77, 104, ... The ratio a(n)/A058313(n) for n = 1..400 is given in A119788.
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 26 2006
